```{.r .cell-code}
library(systemfonts) # Thomas Pederson's recent font management package
library(showtext) ## add google fonts to plots
```

```{.r .cell-code}
library(scico) ## Colour palette
library(ggtext) ## add improved text rendering to ggplot2
library(gfonts) ## Use Google Fonts offline
library(ggrepel) ## Text-repelled labels
library(marquee) ## Annotations with fonts in ggplot
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Clean the slate
systemfonts::clear_local_fonts()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Run `scan_local_fonts()` in order to re-add automatically added fonts
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
systemfonts::clear_registry()

sysfonts::font_add_google("Gochi Hand", "Gochi Hand")
font_add_google("Schoolbell", "Schoolbell")
font_add_google("Roboto Condensed", "Roboto Condensed")
font_add_google("Noto Sans", "Noto")
font_add_google("Jura", "Jura")
font_add_google("Ibarra Real Nova", "Ibarra")
font_add_google("Open Sans", "Open")
font_add_google("Anton", "Anton")
font_add_google("Tangerine", "Tangerine")
font_add_google("Fraunces", "Fraunces")
font_add_google("Alegreya", "Alegreya")

sysfonts::font.families()
```

## Setting the font in ggplot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
theme_custom <- function() {
  theme_bw(base_size = 10) +
    
     theme_sub_plot(
      title = element_text(
        family = "Alegreya",
        size = 14, face = "bold"
      ),
      title.position = "plot",
      subtitle = element_text(
        family = "Alegreya",
        size = 10
      ),
      caption = element_text(
        family = "Alegreya",
        size = 6
      ),
      caption.position = "plot"
    )+

    theme_sub_axis(
      title = element_text(
        family = "Roboto Condensed",
        size = 8
      ),
      text = element_text(
        family = "Roboto Condensed",
        size = 6
      )
    ) +

    theme_sub_legend(
      text = element_text(
        family = "Roboto Condensed",
        size = 6
      ),
      title = element_text(
        family = "Alegreya",
        size = 8
      )
    ) 
}

## Set the theme
ggplot2::theme_set(new = theme_custom())
```
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins %>% 
  drop_na() %>% 
  gf_point(body_mass ~ bill_len) %>% 
  gf_labs(title = "Vanilla Graph", 
          subtitle = "Penguins",
          caption = "How much longer?",
          x = "Bill Length of Penguins", 
          y = "Body Mass of Penguins") %>% 
  gf_annotate(geom = "label", label = "Ashna lives here", x = 45, y = 4500, fill = "moccasin")
```
